info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 12:23PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of San Bernardino County through 100 PM PDT... At 1223 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hwy 18 Between Running Springs And Big Bear, or 8 miles west of Big Bear City, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Bear City, Lake Arrowhead, Big Bear Lake, Running Springs, Seven Oaks, Hwy 18 Between Running Springs And Big Bear, Hwy 38 Between Yucaipa And Onyx Summit, Green Valley Lake, Cedar Glen, and Fawnskin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
